Detailed Description

This is the interface for all terrain blocks.

virtual bool Terrain::BaseTerrainBlock::collide ( WorldTriangle const &  start,
Vector3 const &  end,
TerrainCollisionCallback *  callback 
) const [pure virtual]

This function determines whether the given prism intersects the terrain, and if so where.

Parameters:
start The start face of the prism.
end The end of the line segment.
callback The collision callback.
Returns:
True if there was a collision, false otherwise.

TerrainFinder::Details BaseTerrainBlock::findOutsideBlock ( Vector3 const &  pos  )  [static]

This function finds the block going at the given position.

Parameters:
pos The (world) position of the required block. Only x and z are used.
Returns:
The block and it's transformations. These are set to NULL if no block is found.

float BaseTerrainBlock::getHeight ( float  x,
float  z 
) [static]

This function gets the height at the given position.

Parameters:
x The x coordinate.
z The z coordinate.
Returns:
The height at the given position, or NO_TERRAIN if there is no terrain under the given position.

float  z

z The z coordinate to get the height at.
Returns:
The height at x, z.

virtual bool Terrain::BaseTerrainBlock::load ( std::string const &  filename,
Matrix const &  worldTransform,
Vector3 const &  cameraPosition,
std::string *  error = NULL 
) [pure virtual]

This function loads an BaseTerrainBlock from a file.

Parameters:
filename The file to load the block from.
worldPosition The world position of the block, so the LodManager can correctly load initial LOD.
error If not null and there was an error loading the terrain then this will be set to a description of the problem.
Returns:
True if the load was completely successful, false if a problem occurred.

Implemented in Terrain::CommonTerrainBlock1, Terrain::CommonTerrainBlock2, and Terrain::TerrainBlock2.

BaseTerrainBlockPtr BaseTerrainBlock::loadBlock ( std::string const &  filename,
const Matrix &  worldTransform,
const Vector3 &  cameraPosition,
TerrainSettingsPtr  pSettings,
std::string *  error = NULL 
) [static]

This loads a BaseTerrainBlockPtr from disk.

It creates the appropriate implementation based on the terrain version.

Parameters:
filename The name of the file to load.
worldPosition The position of the block so that correct LOD can be loaded.
cameraPosition The position of the camera so that the correct LOD can be loaded.
pSettings TerrainSettings to use while loading the block.
error If an error occurs in loading then this will be set to a description of the error.
Returns:
A pointer to the loaded terrain block.

virtual Vector3 Terrain::BaseTerrainBlock::normalAt ( float  x,
float  z 
) const [pure virtual]

This function determines the normal at the given point, taking into account holes.

Parameters:
x The x coordinate to get the normal at.
z The z coordinate to get the normal at.
Returns:
The normal at x, z.

Implemented in Terrain::CommonTerrainBlock1, Terrain::CommonTerrainBlock2, and Terrain::TerrainBlock2.

void BaseTerrainBlock::setTerrainFinder ( TerrainFinder &  terrainFinder  )  [static]

This is used to set the terrain finder.

uint32 BaseTerrainBlock::terrainVersion ( std::string &  resource  )  [static]

Gets the terrain version.

This method should only be called when about to create a new terrain block, to find out which version it is.

Parameters:
resource the path to the '/terrain' resource in the cdata file.
Returns:
1 for old terrain, 2 for new terrain, -1 otherwise.
